Seizing the agentic AI advantage: A CEO playbook to solve the gen AI paradox and unlock scalable impact with AI agents

Authors: Alexander Sukharevsky, Dave Kerr, Klemens Hjartar, Lari H√§m√§l√§inen, St√©phane Bout, Vito Di Leo, Guillaume Dagorret

This report addresses the ‚Äògen AI paradox‚Äô ‚Äì the widespread deployment of generative AI (gen AI) technologies within organizations, coupled with limited tangible impact on revenue or business transformation. It argues that current AI deployments are often superficial, utilized primarily as assistants alongside existing workflows, rather than as deeply integrated, transformative agents. The core of the report focuses on the potential of ‚Äòagentic AI‚Äô to bridge this gap. It outlines a CEO-centric playbook for unlocking scalable impact by transitioning from ‚Äòbolted-on‚Äô AI to a strategically integrated approach. The document emphasizes the need for AI to become a catalyst for core business processes, moving beyond simple assistance to drive genuine business transformation. It suggests that a strategic shift towards agentic AI ‚Äì characterized by engagement and active participation within workflows ‚Äì is crucial for realizing the full potential of AI investments. The report highlights the importance of a CEO-led mandate to oversee this transition and ensure that AI initiatives are aligned with overall business goals. The document is intended to provide actionable insights and a strategic framework for organizations seeking to overcome the limitations of current AI deployments and leverage the power of AI agents for sustainable growth and competitive advantage. It‚Äôs a practical guide for leaders navigating the complexities of the current AI landscape and preparing for the agentic era.

Key Concepts:

  • Broad adoption of gen AI is not translating into significant impact.
  • AI needs to be integrated into core processes to drive business transformation.
  • Agentic AI represents a strategy for achieving scalable impact with AI.
  • Horizontal and vertical use cases of generative AI
  • Human-prompted task automation
  • Internal deployment of general-purpose AI tools
  • AI-powered negotiation assistance
  • AI-driven risk assessment for supply chains
  • Agentic AI advantage: A multiagent solution autonomously identifies data anomalies and explains shifts in sales or market share.
  • Human-led modernization: Utilizing human expertise alongside AI to modernize processes.
